node.title: Analyst who aided Trump-Russia dossier charged with lying
node.description: A US-based Russian analyst who was was a significant source for a widely criticised dossier about Donald Trump's relationship with Russia during the 2016 election has been arrested on charges of lying to the FBI.

node.title: Ex-coach's name crossed off Stanley Cup over sex assault allegations
node.description: The decision to cross out the name of the former video coach, who denies the allegations, comes after the results of an independent investigation into his alleged conduct were made public in October.

node.title: Colin Powell's funeral being held Friday at Washington's National Cathedral
node.description: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell was the first Black American to hold that position and other high-ranking jobs in Washington.

node.title: Justice Department sues Texas over new voting law
node.description: The lawsuit alleges the law will "disenfranchise eligible Texas citizens who seek to exercise their right to vote."

node.title: Justice Dept. Sues Texas Over Voting Restrictions
node.description: The department argued that a major voting law passed by Republicans would disenfranchise several groups of vulnerable Texans.

node.title: 5 Questions About the Biden Vaccine Mandate
node.description: The Biden administration has released details of its plan to prevent the spread of the coronavirus at work. Here are answers to some of the questions readers submitted.

node.title: Woman Claims OBGYN Wouldn't Perform Hysterectomy in Case Her 'Sexual Orientation Changes'
node.description: The 27-year-old woman said her doctor did not specify any medical reason she could not go through the procedure.

node.title: Unions, NYC Deal Allows Unvaccinated Workers to Keep Jobs, Benefits If They Meet Exemption
node.description: Unions and the city reached an agreement to allow unvaccinated workers to keep their jobs and benefits if they applied for a religious exemption before Nov. 2.

node.title: Jury Hung on Whether Former Gubernatorial Candidate Kidnapped, Killed 12-Year-Old Girl
node.description: Prosecutors will have to determine if a new trial for kidnapping and murder will take place in the case that has spanned more than 30 years.

node.title: 3M, Dupont Among 14 Sued Over 'Dangerous' Fire Suppressant Used by Firefighters, Military
node.description: Aqueous Film Forming Foam is a fire suppressant used by firefighters, military members and other first responders.

node.title: Senate Confirms Robert Santos, Mexican American First Person of Color to Lead Census Bureau
node.description: Santos is a third-generation Mexican American statistician from San Antonio, Texas, and former president of the American Statistical Association.

node.title: Auckland senior secondary students 'missed school' but not rushing back
node.description: Daily attendance among Year 11-13 students in the first week of reopening ranged from a high of 48 percent for Year 13 students to a low of 38 percent among that year group.

node.title: Sick, alone, far from home - Starship patients struggle in lockdown
node.description: While families who have travelled to Starship Hospital for their children's specialist treatment deal with an added stress, doctors worry about the kids missing out.

node.title: Tuvalu man who arrived from NZ tests negative in second assessment
node.description: A man who arrived in Auckland from Tuvalu and tested positive for Covid-19 in MIQ on Sunday has returned a negative second test.

node.title: Fireworks aimed at police investigating Dunedin fire
node.description: Lives could have been lost after a group of young men set off fireworks causing a pile of rubbish next to a house to go up in flames, police say.

node.title: It's been 50 years since the infamous Attica prison riot
node.description: Inmates held some 36 hostages for five days. And that was just the beginning

node.title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
node.description: What the vaccine deadline means for you.

node.title: Aaron Rodgers Out After Positive Coronavirus Test
node.description: The Green Bay Packers quarterback will miss Sunday’s game against Kansas City after testing positive for the virus and raised questions about his vaccination status.

node.title: Bear 'Absolutely Destroyed' Unlocked Car, Defecated in Back Seat
node.description: The Aspen Police Department posted about the event on social media as a reminder to citizens to lock their cars, homes and trash.

node.title: Bad Weather, Astronaut's Medical Issue Force Delay of SpaceX Launch to Next Week
node.description: The U.S.-German crew was supposed to launch into space to the International Space Station last weekend, but inclement weather resulted in the first delay.

node.title: Police Allegedly Find 25 Pounds of Marijuana, 13 Weapons in Amish Man's House
node.description: Police were investigating other complaints and eventually secured a search warrant to his home.

node.title: Florida Addiction Clinic Operators Convicted of $112 Million Fraud Scheme
node.description: The Justice Department called the plot by two brothers a "massive, multi-year fraudulent billing scheme."

node.title: 'Inheritance impatience' and out-of-reach house prices driving elder abuse
node.description: A lawyer specialising in elder abuse blames rising house prices for fuelling more cases of older people being financially abused by their adult children.

node.title: Health authority accused of denying vaccine funding to kura
node.description: Health officials are being accused of holding out on cash that would help a West Auckland Māori school boost Covid-19 vaccinations in their local community.

node.title: CBS News poll: Have you made a will? Most Americans haven't.
node.description: Just four in 10 Americans have written a will.

node.title: 'Republicans Are Lying': White House on Role Education Played in Virginia's Election
node.description: How race is taught in schools emerged as a wedge issue in Virginia's gubernatorial election.

node.title: Trump's Claim of Privilege in Jan. 6 Probe Knocked by Federal Judge: 'Only One Executive'
node.description: "I don't see where the separation-of-power argument that you're making exists," the judge told Trump's attorney.

node.title: Discarded Beer Can Leads to Arrest of Murder Suspect From 25-Year-Old Cold Case
node.description: Using a genealogy database, police were able to identify the murderer from unidentified blood that was left at the original crime scene.

node.title: Hotel Fight Over Masks Marks Third Incident Involving Southwest Employees in a Month
node.description: Southwest Airlines has been under public scrutiny recently for its employees' conduct.

node.title: US rolls out Covid-19 vaccine for children, ending long wait for some parents
node.description: The first children in the five to 11 age range are being vaccinated against Covid-19 in the United States.

node.title: Woman who flew to Capitol riot in private plane gets prison time
node.description: Jennifer Ryan was ordered to serve 60 days and pay $1,500 in fines.

node.title: New Museum Triennial Explores the Hidden Strengths of Soft Power
node.description: A grab bag of forms and styles, the 2021 Triennial is that rare thing, a big contemporary survey with a cohesive mood.

node.title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
node.description: “Cake” serves up inventive comedy in small bites, and PBS presents a Martin Scorsese documentary about a colorful, musical slice of New York City history.

node.title: Who Gets Left Out of the ‘Great Outdoors’ Story?
node.description: You’ve heard of Davy Crockett. Now meet Lancelot Jones, Sylvia Stark and other Black outdoors pioneers who can redefine our notion of the natural world.

node.title: Conflict-of-Interest Case Has Boris Johnson Reversing Course, Again
node.description: Britain’s prime minister intervened in the case of a Conservative Party lawmaker who faced suspension. A ferocious blowback caused him to retreat, a now familiar path.

node.title: Your Friday Briefing
node.description: U.S. sets deadlines for vaccines.

node.title: Suspects Allegedly Trying to Steal Furnace Caught After Passing Out From Gas Fumes
node.description: Police remain unsure as to why the two suspects were on the hunt for a furnace in the first place.

node.title: Read Dave Portnoy's Full Response to Accusations of Being a 'Sexual Deviant'
node.description: The Barstool Sports founder denied he's ever done anything unseemly with a woman and accused the reporter of digging up dirt to fit a narrative that she already had in mind.

node.title: 'She Has Nothing': Father Asks Why Daughter Charged After Deaths of Her 5 Children in Fire
node.description: Sabrina Dunigan is charged with five counts of child endangerment after an August 6 fire at her apartment.

node.title: Tennessee Will Be Latest State to Defend Banning Transgender People From School Sports
node.description: A lawsuit alleges that the Tennessee law breaches the equal rights safeguards in Title IX and the 14th amendment.

node.title: PG&E to Pay California $125M for 2019 Fire Started By Faulty Equipment, Destroying 174 Homes
node.description: The fire started after decommissioned but energized transmission equipment broke on Oct. 23, ignited surrounding vegetation and scorched over 120 square miles.

node.title: Idaho State Senator Wins Mayoral Election, Plans to Handle Both Jobs
node.description: Republican Dan Johnson ran for mayor in Lewiston, Idaho, and won 52 percent of the vote. He is also in his sixth and final term in the state Senate.

node.title: Baltimore Can't Prevent Catholic Media Outlet From Holding Rally at City Building: Panel
node.description: "Baltimore hopefully learned a lesson in First Amendment law that its taxpayers now have to pay for," the attorney for the outlet said.

node.title: All the coronavirus news you need from across Australia
node.description: The border between Victoria and NSW reopens for the first time in months, as Katherine residents wake to a snap lockdown. Follow live.

node.title: Black Caps beat Scotland at World Cup
node.description: Martin Guptill's 56-ball 93 helps the Black Caps to a 16-run victory over Scotland in the Twenty20 World Cup in Dubai.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (November 7)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Over 40 Countries Pledge at U.N. Climate Summit to End Use of Coal Power
node.description: The United States did not agree to stop coal development at home but promised to halt overseas funding of oil, gas and coal.

node.title: Morrison has a trust problem with no easy solution
node.description: When Scott Morrison fronted the travelling media at a stopover in Dubai on his way home, he looked drained. Here was a man in need of a steaming hot bath, and a big political reset, writes Michelle Grattan.

node.title: Covid-19: New Plymouth mayor at odds with public health unit on modelling
node.description: The mayor of New Plymouth has found himself at odds with the Taranaki Public Health Unit over modelling of the potential impact of a delta outbreak in the province.

node.title: House social spending bill could bring in $1.48 trillion
node.description: Tax hikes in the Build Back Better bill include a surtax on multimillionaires and taxes on stock buybacks, among others.

node.title: Judge Questions Trump’s Grounds for Keeping Jan. 6 Documents Secret
node.description: In a hearing on Thursday, a federal judge voiced skepticism about the former president’s claim that hundreds of pages of documents related to the riot should be shielded by executive privilege.

node.title: Authorities Arrest Analyst Who Contributed to Steele Dossier
node.description: Igor Danchenko, a Russia analyst who worked with Christopher Steele, the author of a dossier of rumors and unproven assertions about Donald J. Trump, was indicted as part of the Durham investigation.

node.title: NYC Mayor-Elect Eric Adams Latest to Accept Initial Salary in Bitcoin
node.description: Adams, who defeated Republican nominee Curtis Sliwa in New York City's mayoral race, previously vowed to make New York City "the center of Bitcoins."

node.title: 'Enough is enough': have Collingwood and the AFL acted too late on violence against women?
node.description: Jordan De Goey has faced several charges of violence against women during his AFL career, but was not stood down by his club until last weekend.

node.title: Did someone tell you QR codes were illegal? Here's all the information you need to debunk that
node.description: A bevy of posts across social media platforms have claimed QR codes and proof-of-vaccination requirements contravene various sections of Australian law. But experts say the claims don't reflect reality.

node.title: The people here were meant to be near the front of the vaccination queue. What went wrong?
node.description: As Sydney's vaccination rate soared over 70 per cent, in Yarrabah it was still 24 per cent. How did this town get left behind?

node.title: Uber drivers suspended after raising COVID-19 concerns, Senate inquiry hears
node.description: An Uber driver who raised concerns about her passengers' compliance with COVID-19 restrictions found that her account was "deactivated" by the company shortly afterwards, a Senate inquiry has heard.

node.title: Australia is preparing for COVID-19 vaccines for young children — but how urgent is the need?
node.description: As state leaders push for all children to be vaccinated by the year's end, National Cabinet mulls vaccines for younger kids. But the regulator is still waiting for details on safety and efficacy.
